intro: Zornia ulei, commonly known as the stickyweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several small, round seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Zornia ulei is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments due to its drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
